modules.description: This module defines a disk geometry structure with cylinders, heads, and sectors, and provides functions to parse this geometry from a binary buffer, derive it from an LBA size, and convert LBA offsets to CHS (Cylinder-Head-Sector) addresses. It works with 32-bit integers for geometry components and 64-bit integers for LBA offsets. Use this module when handling legacy disk geometries for bootloaders, disk imaging, or low-level storage manipulation where CHS addressing is required.

This module defines a data structure for representing a single partition entry in an MBR (Master Boot Record), including its physical layout and metadata such as boot flag, type, and sector ranges. It provides functions to construct a partition with specified LBA start and size, extract sector information, and parse a partition entry from a binary buffer. Concrete use cases include reading and writing partition tables on storage devices, validating disk layouts, and building disk images.

This module represents and manipulates Master Boot Records, including bootstrap code, disk signature, time fields, and partition entries. It provides functions to construct, serialize, and deserialize MBRs, validate partition layouts, and manage disk geometry with 32-bit and 64-bit integer types. Use it for disk imaging, bootloader development, or low-level partition table editing.
